structure.unit: PART I CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENT AND CHARTER

text.section:
SECTION 9.08. REVISIONS.
At least once in every 5 year period the Board shall review the Charter and determine whether or not there is a need for revision. If the Board determines that a revision is needed, it shall establish a procedure for the preparation of a proposed revision of the Charter. The proposed revision shall then be presented to the Board for review, modification and approval. If the Board approves such proposed revision, either with or without modification, it shall present such proposed revision to the electorate in accordance with the provisions of(C) and (D). Simultaneous elections may be held on a proposed revision and on individual amendments that are proposed.
